pendingTasks.text:
1. Let's quickly learn about the Guide app. Starting with setting the focus for this goal - "learning about Guide app".
HOW: From the top, click 'See all goals', then click 'Set Focus' against the goal. Pick today's date, for example.

2. Let's mark the above ('Set focus' task) and this task as "Done".
HOW: Click the 'Done' button for Task 1 above and enter a comment on what you did. At least 5 chars. Repeat for this task card too.

3. Task Bowl is your complete list of To-Do's you can pick from. Hidden from focus area till you decide you are ready. Let's add two tasks from the Task Bowl. And then mark this one DONE.
HOW: Click the 'Task Bowl' link at the bottom. Click 'Add to Today' button for task 4 and task 5.

taskBowl.text: 16. That's it! You are ready to continue using / exploring the Guide on your own. And hope it helps you a bit. Just remember not to consider it yet another To-Do list. Use it for tips when you are low. And for managing your path to your goals :) We don't track you. So, it'd be nice to hear from you if you found it helpful or have any feedback. Drop a mail at '[github-account-name-here]+guide@gmail.com'. Or star our repo leave issues at https://github.com/nextfiveinc/guide

15. Enable AI powered features of Guide by setting your own API key in the settings. This will allow you to use next step "Help" on tasks. Or Next step guidance on Goals with "Guide me". "What should I focus on" helps you quickly identify the right direction. Click the AI icon at top left right besides Home button - to see other stuff Guide can help you with using AI.
HOW: Go to Settings and enter your API key for the provider you want in the "AI Provider Settings" section. Select your Active AI Provider from the dropdown. And click "Save AI Settings" button.

14. Save your Guide settings and progress. You can do a 1-click export if you are using Guide on a laptop. If on phone, you can still view / copy / edit the settings right within the app.
HOW: Click the 'Cog-wheel Settings icon' at the bottom right. Under \\\"AI Provider Settings\\\" - click 'Export Full Backup' button. Or click 'View / Edit Backup'.

13. Guide offers tips on how to deal with stress when you are feeling rudderless or have a cluttered mind.
HOW: Click the 'Stressed' button at the top-right. Click 'Interactive Guide' button for guidance based on how are you feeling in the moment.

12. Guide helps you get unblocked when you are feeling overwhelmed or stuck.
HOW: Click the 'Blocked' button at the top-left. Click 'Help Me Get Unblocked' button for interactive guidance based on what are you struggling with. Or explore all tips.

11. Reminders to self keep you on track. Guide helps you keep them handy.
HOW: Click the 'Reminders' link at the bottom right.

10. References are similar to reminders but you can use them to keep some handy details. I am using them to keep track of few notes files I want to review every week or so. Use it your way.
HOW: Click the 'References' link at the bottom.

9. Routines set you free. These are predefined list of regular tasks that you can add to your list in 1-click. Like morning review tasks. Or weekly review. Anything.
HOW: Click the 'Routines' link at the bottom. Click the blue 'Edit' button for Morning Kickstart routine and add one more task on a new line after 'Go for a run', 'Coffee & Daily posts'. You can load all tasks in a routine using the 'Load' button.

8. Guide can help you build momentum when you are stuck by automatically adding a small task for you to complete and get moving.
HOW: Click the 'Task Bowl' link at the bottom. Click 'blue Plus button' and click 'Auto-Add'. You can also do so form the home screen.

7. Let's add a new task. Say, 'Check out the code the Guide app page at nextfive.in/toolish/guide '
HOW: Click the 'Task Bowl' link at the bottom. Click 'blue Plus button', enter a task and click 'Add'. You can also do so form the home screen.

6. Let's take a short break. Let's ask Guide on what to do when bored.
HOW: Click the 'Bored' button at top center. Click 'Surprise Me!' for suggestions.
NOTE: You can ask for 'Something else' 3 times before the system forces a pause. So that you don't keep on playing with options :) You don't need a paradox of choices.

5. You are getting good at this. Got quite a bit done! Let's see what all you did already in the 'Done' section below. And then mark this task too as 'Done'
HOW: Click the 'Done List' link at the bottom left. You can filter this list as you want.

4. Let's add couple of goals of your own; something you'd want to work towards over next 3 months or so.
HOW: Click the 'See all goals' link at the top and click on 'Add New Goal' button.

goals.text: Learn about what Guide - this app - is all about

data.referencesContent:
These are similar to reminders but you can use them to keep some handy details. I am using them to keep track of few notes files I want to review every week or so. Use it your way. 

Click the **Edit** button below to get started. 

---

# NOTE
- Basic **Markdown** _formatting_ supported.
data.remindersContent:
Reminders to self keep you on track. Guide helps you keep them handy. Use them your way. 

_Say, a reminder to what did you really wanted to focus on this year._

Click the **Edit** button below to get started. 

---

# NOTE
- Basic **Markdown** _formatting_ supported.

blockedTips.text: Don't let fear of asking hold you back
No perfect plan exists, start with good enough
Deliver four iterations in short loops - bad to great - instead of a single perfect one.
If stuck for 5+ minutes, take a call and move on; Most decisions are cheap. And reversible.
If stuck for 5+ minutes, take a call and move on; Most decisions are cheap. And reversible.
Work best one thing at a time

rudderless: Focus on quantity over quality for momentum
overwhelmed: List worries and see what's real vs. catastrophisation
Write it all down, brain dump, pick just any 1-2 items that matter today
Drop items until you're left with 2-3
You're doing better than you think; Step back and see what you've achieved.
Remind yourself some commitments might be voluntary
cluttered: Write it all down, brain dump, pick just any 1-2 items that matter today
control: Remind yourself some commitments are voluntary
Permit 2 hours free time daily. Priortize this slot first on your calendar. Everything else will need to move around.
uncertain: Check if making it bigger than necessary
Plans don't need to be perfect
Permit 2 hours free time daily - Let your mind wander, it's essential
generic: Plans don't need to be perfect, just execute and pivot.
Focus on quantity over quality to build momentum.
Break down tasks into smaller chunks.
Get small things 'done' to build momentum.
